title: Cirencester coach selected for England Futsal squad | Wilts and Gloucestershire Standard
body_text:
THE HEAD COACH of Cirencester College's women's football academy has been selected to represent England next month.
Kerry Walklett, head coach of the college’s women’s football academy, who has been selected for the England Futsal squad for the upcoming FIFA Futsal World Cup Qualifiers.
Kerry, who also plays for Cardiff City FC Women, began coaching the Cirencester College Women’s football academy in September 2022, and has led the squad to back-to-back victories in the Association of College’s Women’s Football League Midlands Division, and South West Regional League A respectively.
Kerry will travel to Moldova with the Futsal Lionesses squad in October for the qualifying matches.
She said: “I’m really honoured to be selected to represent England in October.
“The camps and selections process started last year and it’s something I’ve worked really hard to be a part of, so to be chosen was really exciting.
"Going to the World Cup Qualifiers is something I’m really excited to experience, the whole squad has been working really hard to prep the best we can, and we are looking forward to testing ourselves against some really experienced countries."
"This will be my third season as the Women’s Football Academy Coach at Cirencester College, and I’ve thoroughly enjoyed my time so far.
"It’s great to see the standard and the number of girls playing each year considerably improve.
"It really demonstrates how far women’s football has grown over the last five to ten years.
"I’m looking forward to starting the season with a new squad and seeing what we can achieve!”
Ross Langworthy, sport lecturer and manager of the Cirencester College football academy, said “Kerry is an outstanding role model to any young female footballer and our Women’s Academy players are incredibly fortunate to be able to learn from someone of her playing and coaching calibre.
"Kerry has always been passionate about the growth of female football and our programme has gone to strength to strength under her guidance, both in terms of participation numbers and performance.
"Football at Cirencester College is in a fantastic place.
"Both our men’s and women’s squad enjoyed very successful seasons last year and we are looking forward to the year ahead.”
For more information on this story please contact chloe.suter@cirencester.ac.uk
